<a id="IP"></a>

# IP

**Inherits:** [Object](Object.md)

Internet protocol (IP) support functions such as DNS resolution.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

IP contains support functions for the Internet Protocol (IP). TCP/IP support is in different classes (see [StreamPeerTCP](StreamPeerTCP.md) and [TCPServer](TCPServer.md)). IP provides DNS hostname resolution support, both blocking and threaded.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Constants

<a id="IP_constant_RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES** = `256` [ðŸ”—](#IP_constant_RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES)

Maximum number of concurrent DNS resolver queries allowed, [RESOLVER_INVALID_ID](IP.md#IP_constant_RESOLVER_INVALID_ID) is returned if exceeded.

<a id="IP_constant_RESOLVER_INVALID_ID"></a>

<!-- classref-constant -->

**RESOLVER_INVALID_ID** = `-1` [ðŸ”—](#IP_constant_RESOLVER_INVALID_ID)

Invalid ID constant. Returned if [RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES](IP.md#IP_constant_RESOLVER_MAX_QUERIES) is exceeded.

<hr class="classref-section-separator"/>

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="IP_method_clear_cache"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **clear_cache**\ (\ hostname\: [String](String.md) = ""\ ) [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_clear_cache)

Removes all of a `hostname`'s cached references. If no `hostname` is given, all cached IP addresses are removed.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_erase_resolve_item"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **erase_resolve_item**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_erase_resolve_item)

Removes a given item `id` from the queue. This should be used to free a queue after it has completed to enable more queries to happen.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_get_local_addresses"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **get_local_addresses**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_get_local_addresses)

Returns all the user's current IPv4 and IPv6 addresses as an array.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_get_local_interfaces"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md)\[[Dictionary](Dictionary.md)\] **get_local_interfaces**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_get_local_interfaces)

Returns all network adapters as an array.

Each adapter is a dictionary of the form:

```
    {
        "index": "1", # Interface index.
        "name": "eth0", # Interface name.
        "friendly": "Ethernet One", # A friendly name (might be empty).
        "addresses": ["192.168.1.101"], # An array of IP addresses associated to this interface.
    }
```


<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_get_resolve_item_address"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **get_resolve_item_address**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_get_resolve_item_address)

Returns a queued hostname's IP address, given its queue `id`. Returns an empty string on error or if resolution hasn't happened yet (see [get_resolve_item_status()](IP.md#IP_method_get_resolve_item_status)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_get_resolve_item_addresses"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Array](Array.md) **get_resolve_item_addresses**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_get_resolve_item_addresses)

Returns resolved addresses, or an empty array if an error happened or resolution didn't happen yet (see [get_resolve_item_status()](IP.md#IP_method_get_resolve_item_status)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_get_resolve_item_status"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[ResolverStatus](IP.md#enum_IP_ResolverStatus) **get_resolve_item_status**\ (\ id\: [int](int.md)\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_get_resolve_item_status)

Returns a queued hostname's status as a [ResolverStatus](IP.md#enum_IP_ResolverStatus) constant, given its queue `id`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_resolve_hostname"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[String](String.md) **resolve_hostname**\ (\ host\: [String](String.md), ip_type\: [Type](IP.md#enum_IP_Type) = 3\ ) [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_resolve_hostname)

Returns a given hostname's IPv4 or IPv6 address when resolved (blocking-type method). The address type returned depends on the [Type](IP.md#enum_IP_Type) constant given as `ip_type`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_resolve_hostname_addresses"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[PackedStringArray](PackedStringArray.md) **resolve_hostname_addresses**\ (\ host\: [String](String.md), ip_type\: [Type](IP.md#enum_IP_Type) = 3\ ) [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_resolve_hostname_addresses)

Resolves a given hostname in a blocking way. Addresses are returned as an [Array](Array.md) of IPv4 or IPv6 addresses depending on `ip_type`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator"/>

<a id="IP_method_resolve_hostname_queue_item"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](int.md) **resolve_hostname_queue_item**\ (\ host\: [String](String.md), ip_type\: [Type](IP.md#enum_IP_Type) = 3\ ) [ðŸ”—](#IP_method_resolve_hostname_queue_item)

Creates a queue item to resolve a hostname to an IPv4 or IPv6 address depending on the [Type](IP.md#enum_IP_Type) constant given as `ip_type`. Returns the queue ID if successful, or [RESOLVER_INVALID_ID](IP.md#IP_constant_RESOLVER_INVALID_ID) on error.
